body_html:
@jekbradbury, I'm not 100% sure but I think style only works with the "fork" context, since the objects are inherited (which doesn't work with CUDA multiprocessing). A lot of the multiprocessing recommendations I was reading seemed to target pre-Python 3 when only "fork" was supported on Unix. Inheriting objects, instead of pickling them, is supposed to be "better":

"Better to inherit than pickle/unpickle"
https://docs.python.org/3/library/multiprocessing.html

This seems a bit foolish to me since it doesn't work on Windows and it doesn't work with "spawn".
